attributes.action: Tougher sentencing for carers who steal from their vulnerable service users.
attributes.additional_details:
Jane Largue Flisher from the Malling area stole £11,000 from two vulnerable clients, she received a 20 month suspended sentence and 100 hours community service. 
What protection does this give vulnerable people?
attributes.background: In my local area, over the past two months, three carers have stolen over £50,000 combined and have not received a custodial sentence, they were all given suspended sentences. This petition has been set up to get justice for the vulnerable people and the families that they steal from.

rejection.details:
A judge or magistrate already has to think about whether the offender has stolen from a vulnerable victim and whether the offender is in a position of trust when they decide sentences, so we're not sure what else you'd like Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking the Government or Parliament to change the law so that people who steal from vulnerable people when they are working in a position of trust are automatically given a custodial sentence.
